Title: N/A

reviewText: Before there was Zombieland, there was Ahhh, Zombies!This comedy is done from the zombies' point of view. It starts with the usual cliche: an army experiment gone bad. A toxic concoction accidentally contaminates a group of people that turns them into zombies. The action is concentrated around two young couples and a Rambo wannabe. The film  changes from black and white to color, representing the zombies' or the humans' perspective; the zombies see themselves as talking and walking normally whereas the rest are talking and walking at an accelerated pace. The Rambo wannabe convinces them that the concoction turned them into supersoldiers but turned other people into murdering lunatics. In short, it's a weird Rashomon scenario. The acting is good and the jokes are plentiful.
Title: N/A

reviewText: "Aaaaah!  Zombies!"----------------------------------Note: mild spoilers below----------------------------------"Shaun Of The Dead" will remain the gold standard of zomb-comedies (although some might argue that the entire genre is comedic...) but "Aaaaah!  Zombies!" provides a few good guffaws. The premise is great: the protagonists, a group of self-involved twenty-somethings have been infected with a government-created zombie virus but they are unaware that they have become zombies. Their perceptions alter so that, in their slow, shambling forms, they now see normal humans as hyperactive weirdos with high, squeaky voices.  Although they can talk among themselves and have rational conversations, all humans is rahhh!!! grunt! argh! and it takes the zombie kids a while to catch on to their true predicament.  It's a funny concept, deliberately framed as a goofy, super-cheapo midnight movie, packed with -- indeed, entirely constructed out of --  irony-laden, relentlessly cliched dialogue and crass, broad, see-it-coming-a-mile-away humor. Some of it's effective, but the film could have used a little more punch, and perhaps slightly crisper, more vigorous editing. Of course, I was not stoned or intoxicated while watching it, and doubtless that would help with the viewing experience.Not great, but worth checking out if you're a zombie flick fanatic. (Axton)
Title: N/A

reviewText: A military experiment goes awry when a strength-enhancing serum turns test subjects into flesh-eating zombies instead of super-soldiers. Of course, the rest of the serum, shipped in 50 gallon drums, is accidentally unleashed on the surrounding populace. Somehow, mixed w/ some unknown X-factor, the serum turns four unsuspecting young people into invincible super-soldiers, while transforming others into shambling flesh-eaters. Joined by a military operative, the five must solve this problem before it spreads beyond the town. At least that's what these poor schmucks think is going on! It's all a matter of perspective, really. AAAH! ZOMBIES!! is a purposefully ridiculous horror / comedy. As such, it does have some funny moments. Unfortunately, its scatological approach tends to make it a bit too silly in spots. It also feels padded out. This is another full-length feature that would have made a far better short film, or horror anthology segment. It suffers from its own meandering plot. If it had been edited down to about 20-30 minutes it could have been hilarious! Worth a watch...

reviewText: AAAH! ZOMBIES!! stars Matt Davis (The Vampire Diaries) in a really entertaining twist on the conventional zombie movie.  Much of the story is told from the perspective of the brain-eating undead themselves which makes this film one of the more unique horror-comedies in recent years.  AAAH! ZOMBIES!! has some classic lines, hilarious situations, and is a must have for horror comedy fans everywhere. If you liked ZOMBIELAND and SHAUN OF THE DEAD, you'll dig this movie.  Highly Recommend.

reviewText: I thought I'd spend maybe 10 minutes before going to bed watching this...and did not expect to spend the next hour and a half laughing my ears off.  I almost never laugh out loud at movies, but this one had me howling.  The hackneyed "soldier" can't say a thing that's not Hollywood stock script for a tough soldier, which is preposterously funny when he's trying to keep his friends in line.  And when the Zombies have to play dead to escape...well, you get the idea.  "Hey, drive faster!"  "Hey, man, I'm a Zombie."Very much worth seeing if you like completely ridiculous humor.  Sort of like Monty Python, Zombie Edition.

reviewText: I really had my doubts going into watching this movie. Even the cover art for the film isn't that appealing (and probably part of the reason I avoided this film for so long). Finally sat down and watched "Aaah! Zombies!"...I absolutely love it! The script is really good and pretty original. Think Sean of the Dead from the zombie point-of-view. It has it's semi-serious moments and other moments that were truly funny! My favorite scene of the movie has to be when the zombies win the bowling game and do their celebration dance. To see zombies, who don't know they are zombies, try to dance is hilarious! This is the kind of movie I watched and immediately wanted to see again once it was over. Very fun
summary: Definitely Worth Watching If You Love Zombies

reviewText: Just a waste of time unless, of course, wasting time is your highlight. Funny?, well  in the same sense that '30s slapstick was funny because then low budget film was such a novel experience that anything stupid was laughable. Low budget today is just an excuse for any film that gets old really fast; uses cheap cheesy props and actors with overwhelming made for TV series acting experience. Only rarely is low budget anything but bad. How low a budget? The first 15 minutes was video of a supposedly full barrel rolling and bouncing down a street only it bounces like it's empty. The next 45 minutes shows video of a few people sitting, talking and walking with computer generated veins. The final 30 minutes shows the same few people bowling with computer generated veins.The attempts at humor were bad cliches and the zombie horror was a couple of computer generated blood scenes and that's it. Oh, and zombies thinking that they are normal and the  living are weird doesn't work because zombies are brain dead - dummies.

reviewText: This is a gem to me.  Unfortunate that there are no bonus features since this is one movie that could have had a fun commentary at least.  There is no nudity and little gore, but what it does have are some really fun characters and good writing.  This film makes the zombies the heroes which i love most about it.  So don't hope to see Walking Dead or something - the military and others are the bad guys here.  It's all about 4 friends and a soldier who happen to end up becoming zombies, but they don't know it.  That is where the comedy is, to each other they seem normal - other than some superhuman abilities.  They think they have become super soldiers and that others around them are infected with some hyper rage.  The movie splits between the friends interacting in color and goes black and white Night of the Living Dead style when they are viewed by others around them.  It is a very funny Zomedy or Zom Com and you really get to care for the zombies thanks to some good acting and writing.
summary: A must own for zombie lovers

reviewText: If you are NOT a zomedy fan, then don't even bother! but if  you are,this movie is so over the top that you can't help but wonder how it came about.The zombies see themselves as living people and everyone else as superfast infected people. It's silly and fun and these average folks try to avoid the 'zombies' as they tear into people. And this is not extrem gore by any means but it's not for little kids either.  Still you have to love low budget flicks to like this one and the acting is better than many flicks of this level. The c level or low b... anyways I liked this one and found it interesting with a few laughs and it's overall attitude is zany. As the zombies want to flee to their own town to be free , free to rot I guess , even as they are lead by a talking head? You see,it's zaniness all the way and serious zombie fans will not like it maybe but I did.  The dvd looks great too.
summary: low budget zomedy with wierd premise.

You have not lived until you see a zombie trying to pass himself off as a waiter in a Mexican restaurant.

reviewText: I Caught this on Netflix the other day.As a regular viewer of all things zombie, I've seen quite a few "humorous" zombie films that fell pretty flat. This is one of the better low budget zombie films and actually is funny at times. Those times tend to be when we are shown something from the zombies perspective and then things switch over to the non-infected point of view. Yes, there's a zombie's point of view in this movie that makes it different from 95% of all the other zombie films out there.Don't expect Shaun of the Dead with this film...it's not of that caliber. If you're a true zombie fan, however, you're probably going to enjoy this film.
summary: Pretty good for low budget zombie comedy.

reviewText: <strong>AAAH! Zombies!</strong> (Matthew Kohnen, 2007)This is a movie I really, really wanted to love with all my heart. Done well, it could have been paradigm-shifting. Genre-defining. It could have made the zombie movie something more, and better, than it is today. However, because if its many, many shortcomings, there's no real chance of that ever happening, and unless someone really, really good comes along and does a remake, that will not change.Plot: four friends, all of whom are different flavors of your basic idiot, by chance (and ice cream) ingest a super-secret toxic substance that was supposed to vanish into the ocean without a trace. The four are Tim (<em>Bones</em>' Michael Grant Terry), the nose-to-the-grindstone kid who's been pining for the girl next door for ten years and has never managed to get up the courage to ask her out. Then there's the girl next door herself, Cindy (TV character actress Betsy Buetler; gamer geeks may recognize the voice from <em>Dragon Age: Origins</em>), who's just plain too ditzy to have picked up on Tim's attention. Then there's Tim's best friend, the typical party dude, Mike (<em>Blue Crush</em>'s Matthew Davis), and his backstabbing, get-ahead-however ex-girlfriend Vanessa (Julianna Martin from the McBride TV-movie franchise). A few minutes later, the four of them are zombies. Here's the real kicker, the paradigm-shifting moment--they don't realize they're zombies. They come across a soldier, Nick Steele (<em>Changeling</em>'s Colby French), who informs them there's a zombie plague, and it all slots into place: everyone ELSE is infected! They need to protect their families and all that other good stuff. Except, well, they don't know they're zombies.Can I possibly get across to you how cool this idea is? And I'm not even riding it for being a zombedy; after all, the greatest game-changer since Romero was stupid slapstick (1986's <em>Return of the Living Dead</em>), but it was also a brilliant piece of moviemaking. This is not. While some of the acting is halfway decent (French is by far the best of this bunch, and understands how to almost, but not quite, overplay his role while everyone else around him crosses that line in the first three minutes of the movie), and there are a few clever bits to be had in the script, most of it is your basic zombie movie, but told from the perspective of the zombies. It could have been so, so, so much more than it is. I hope someone picks this ball up and runs with it. *

I say "nope" to point to the fact that this is not as funny as S.O.T.D. stuff or FIDO, so adjust your sights on comedy from a diff' angle. I'd rent or, search the web and youTube for film clips and watch them before buying. Just not a zombie film for most zombie film freaks if you like to focus on the more classing zombie action and such.

reviewText: I have seen countless zombie movies but this one was a fun ride! The lead characters not knowing they were the zombies wow what an idea!! The black and white film during their alive parts was genius. Then color when they were zombies as if they were reborn. I laughed and felt sad for them at first then as the movie moves along I rooted for them and their dream of their own land without judgement . If you take it too seriously then you may not like it!! but... if you are willing to let go and be told a unique story with great characters then this is for you! Im definitely going to watch it again to see if I missed anything. Thanks aaah! zombies! a fun ride! something unique! awesome!!!!!

reviewText: Okay, who the heck tried to pass off a film student assignment as an award winning zomedy movie?  After you've spent fifteen minutes forwarding through this failure, you might wanna get rid of it and never, ever talk about Aaah! Zombies!! again, ever.  It's definitely not one to recommend and I wouldn't go telling friends you saw it either.  How bad is it?  Its so bad that serious reviewers are too embarassed to admit they fell for the creative cover and comic twist.  And just how did it earn a four star average out of 38 reviews and counting you might ask? Creative marketing, to go along with the creative cover and unfulfilled comedy hour.Here's what you do, think of the worse teen horror movie you've ever watched, imagine making some of the color scenes black and white, and finally, add teen zombies.......from los angeles.  Do yourself a favor and just read a good zombie book.  And if for some unimagineable reason you do choose to indulge, remember I warned you!This should be enough to tell you to stay away from this one.  I give you Aah Zombies awards list:Scream Fest Audience AwardZompire Fest Audience AwardBeverly Hills Film Festival Audience AwardFestivus Film Festival Best Picture
